title-group.article-title: Targets Performance in Terminated Bids: An Empirical Examination

abstract.p: In this paper, we first explore the targets' performance around the announcement of cancelled bids. Using a sample of 272 firms between 2000 and 2007, we document positive abnormal returns at the time of the bid announcement and negative returns at the time of the bid withdrawal. We find that the negative abnormal returns around withdrawal do not completely reverse the positive returns earned around the initial announcement. The returns around withdrawal depend on whether the transaction has been terminated by the target or by the bidder and on whether it involves a target from the same industry. We also investigate what determines the probability that the transaction is terminated by either party and examine the probability that the target is acquired successfully after the bid withdrawal. We find the latter to depend on the target's profitability, the target's industry, and the number of days between announcement and termination.
